snippet: A blue-ribbon commission’s report to Congress on the state of the humanities arrives amid disturbing allegations against one of its members.
abstract: American Academy of Arts and Sciences report defending the beleaguered liberal arts, requested by Congress in 2010, is set to be released amid controversy surrounding Leslie Cohen Berlowitz, who as president of academy was one of report's prime movers; Berlowitz stepped away from her responsibilities at academy after charges that she falsely held a doctoral degree.
lead_paragraph: A blue-ribbon commission’s report to Congress on the state of the humanities arrives amid disturbing allegations against one of its members.
